author: omegaqz47
title: Telephone consultations with my GP
body:
I have had a number of telephone consultations with my GP practice in last number of months.  
Dr McGuinness was absolutely wonderful during those consultations, she put me at ease and made a very difficult time for me so much easier.  
I worried that over the telephone I wouldn’t be able to convey what I needed, but her professionalism and above all kindness meant it did not matter.  
I feel that in these times our GPS who are doing an excellent job should be applauded.

author: TobyM
title: Professional and caring asthma review
body:
I saw practice nurse Hannah today for a check in on my annual asthma review!  
Very professional and caring and listen's well.

title: Lovely staff
body: The staff were really good at the job caring about me I go to carter's green practice. Would change over to this practice

author: Mixed up but mindful
title: Automated telephone systems
body:
I know that Heeley Green surgery has changed over the last few years but it's taken me a while to see how much it has changed for the worst. Since Clover took over the surgery I've noticed a massive change in the staff. It seems like out with the old and in with the new. The staff are nice but not recognising some of the staff is a bit disturbing because I don't cope very well with changes due to having depression and borderline personality disorder.  
To make things worse I phoned the doctors up for a appointment what I knew would be a telephone call appointment which is not a problem. I'm okay with the receptionist asking me what I'm wanting help with. What I'm not happy with is the new telephone system which is automated, saying that all calls will be recorded for training and monitoring. That is so wrong and feels very intrusive that I am been recorded without my permission.  
I also find it hard to trust people that's why I only like talking to the same doctors who have known me for years. I have always been able to talk to my GP about anything even if it's very personal, knowing it would be kept confidential. Sometimes I've been asked if I don't mind having a medical student sit in doing training that was also fine, or I would be asked if I would like to fill in a questionnaire form about my experience. That is also was fine because I was able to have the choice to say yes or no.  
Now that I know that I'm being recorded I have found it very intrusive and upsetting. I also feel paranoid that when the recordings are been listed to that I'm going to be laughed at because of my mental health issues. I sort of understand that the recordings are for the benefit of the patients and staff,but for a few days after my telephone conversation my depression got worse because of the recordings.  
Like the saying goes if it isn't broken don't try and fix it.  
I think the old way the surgery was run was the best way.

author: gardengnome
title: bowel cancer from diagnoses to outcome.
body:
After being diagnosed with bowel cancer I was treated in a wonderful and timely way by the staff at Inverclyde Royal Hospital (IRH). All the staff acted in a very professional and friendly manner. The consultant Miss Brown is a wonderful surgeon with a great bedside manner and a pleasant person. I cannot praise her and her teams work too highly. the ward staff were also a great and patient team. The food was surprisingly good not what i expectd.  
I would certainly recommend the IRH to anyone.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: eaterjx43
title: Felt confident and at ease
body:
I felt the care and advice we received from Katie at my son's appointment was fantastic  
I felt at ease and confident in what we were being told.

author: Ossie1960
title: CARE REVEIVED
body: Spent 9 day in the MAU causeway ,it is never nice to be in hospital but thanks to the care l received and the friendly faces always smiling my stay was as pleasant as possible ,all the nurses and doctors took time to listen to my concerns and answer my questions ,and to explain everything to me ,l have never been looked after by such caring ,friendly,pleasant nurses and will miss every one of them

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ginti Cairns
title: Our brilliant treatment via NHS 24 on Christmas Day
body: Our 14 year old son had been unwell for a couple of days (not COVID) with fever and sore throat, then on Christmas morning woke with obvious signs of strep throat and really poorly. We were able to access very prompt care via 111, with call back from a doctor within the hour. Antibiotics were available for us 30 minutes later at the ERI OPD6. The people we spoke to were helpful and caring. Amazing service - I work for the NHS and this reinforces how lucky we are to have it.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: decembereb55
title: Broken Hip
body:
I had a broken hip in early November , and from the moment I went to A &E until I got home a couple of days later, the operation and the after care was marvellous.  
Everyone was very professional and attentive , thank you very much  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
  
[Unsure about 'Reception']

author: corvusen65
title: Cannot speak highly enough of the staff
body: .I was very pleased with the treatment I received in Coleraine hospital I was in Coleraine hospital for 11 days in surgical ward 2, I cannot speak highly enough about the staff, mr patterson and all his team off Doctors especially Dr Aberdeen as i called her 😁 also to Deborah and her team of nurses who could not do enough for me to make sure my stay was as comfortable as possible and to nurse Keira who held my hand during a few scary times and told me everything was ok an she wouldnt leave me. Many Thanks.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Susie1277
title: Visit to ulster Ed department
body: My poor 8 year old tested positive for covid and had to go to hospital as we couldn’t get her temp down and she wouldn’t stop vomiting! Despite a very full and busy Ed department I just want to commend the nurse nikkita who really cared for her and was very quick to ensure her vomiting was treated. Then dr mark who made a very scared 8 year old feel less so and was able to get her home. She was treated with such kindness and they really talked to her on her level! Thank you so much for care despite the immense pressures.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Quinng
title: Thank you all
body: I went in to Ward 5 as a day case for a Cardioversion. My experience was excellent. Karen was the nurse looking after me. She met me at the door, was clearly expecting me and from then on looked after me superbly. She was friendly, reassuring and attentive and put me at ease. Everyone I came into contact with was kind and caring and what might have been a daunting experience was in fact a very positive one. Thanks to you all but most especially Karen. What a wonderful advert for the NHS.

author: pyxisst54
title: Amazing care for our daddy!
body: I'm one of 7 siblings and the nominated family visitor for my father who is almost 4 weeks in Craigavon now -  spent on  Ward 2 North with Covid. It's an absolutely traumatising time for all of us, however we cannot thank the medical team enough for the care and support they give to daddy and us as a family. I definitely won't thank you for that Denpro mask lol! The team are beyond amazing and daddy is so well cared for through this v tough time. Thank-you Team 2 North.xx

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SRaff
title: Lovely caring GP
body:
The GP came to see my dad at home. He has recently been diagnosed with non hodkins lymphoma and he has been struggling with various symptoms and feeling very anxious. Everything happened very suddenly when he became very unwell and was admitted to hospital and needed emergency surgery for a bowel obstruction. It was only after this we found out he had non hodkins lymphoma. Since his surgery he has been very unwell and weak and I have been trying me best to care for him but have also been feeling very anxious because I'm so worried about him.  
I contacted my GP surgery to ask for a review of my dad for his anxiety and other symptoms. The GP was absolutely amazing. She came to visit my dad at he and listened to everything he had to say about how he was feeling and suggested a medication that could help with a number of his symptoms. She also took the time to ask me how I was coping and to help me out as well. In cx addition she chased up his haematology appointment and called me very soon after she left to let me know when my dad's appointment would be and planned to call me later that day for an update.  
The GP really put me and my dad at ease today. After she left my dad had the best day he has had in a long time and I felt so relieved. My dad commented that she is a lovely person and a great listener.

author: Nighthawk
title: Staff went the extra mile to give us a wonderful Christmas
body:
Whilst being admitted to hospital  
As usual we were treated to a fantastic service even in these trying times  
The staff going the extra mile to make our stay a most comforting one .  
I along with many others had to spend Christmas at Medway maritime hospital and for us on Brontë ward the staff went the extra mile on Christmas Day and surprised us with Christmas presents which I must say was a humbling experience as I am used to giving help to others not so lucky in life  
May I say a big thank you to all of them and wish them a very happy and prosperous new year

author: xraymr55
title: Attentive and Caring Staff
body:
I had biopsies taken on Thursday the 23rd of December in forth valley hospital the staff were so attentive and caring especially David and Laura they put me so much at ease.  
The care I received was excellent and I would like to thank the staff so much

author: Keiron
title: My son had an anaphylaxis
body:
My son was rushed to A&E with anaphylactic due to coming into contact with nuts.  
From the moment we arrived to the A&E reception the level of professionalism was exceptional, the nurses quick thinking rushed my son through resuscitation room whilst my wife was still giving his credentials, to where they took his oxygen level / stats where they were alarming low.  
The doctors / nurses gave him a nebuliser, they then assessed him and concluded that he was having anaphylactic reaction, they then administered an injection to stabilise, his situation as a result this life threatening situation was quickly, promptly dealt with. I wish to thank the staff who dealt with him in how they dealt with the situation in a professional manner, I would particularly like to thank nurse Adele and her colleagues for promptly dealing with the situation and assuring me, my wife and son in a stressful situation. Thank you for your dedication

author: Bruno33
title: Opthamology
body:
I required a cataract operation and as I was barely able to see out of my right eye I was getting desperate.  
After arriving at ward 25 I found ALL members of staff pleasant and helpful. After a short wait I was taken to the operating area and introduced to the theatre nurse who was excellent and soon put me in the picture as to what would happen. I then met with Dr Gillan who explained the operation in detail which put me at ease. During the operation Dr. Gillan kept me informed at all times as to what he was doing and I appreciated this.  
Since coming home I have noticed a great difference with a daily improvement which has left me without needing to wear glasses except when reading very small print. I found the whole procedure was very relaxing and couln't be better. My thanks to all staff of ward 25 and especially to Dr. Gillan and his assistant to whom I am eternally grateful.

author: Duckman93
title: Inpatient at Leicester General Hospital
body:
29th November 2021 on ward 23, then into theatre for a radical cystectomy. A couple of days in HDU then onto ward 26 for my recovery process. All, and I mean ALL staff were caring and compassionate (but firm) in teaching me how to deal with life with a urostomy, which is a very steep learning curve.  
Thank you, Leicester General urology team for giving me my life back. You are brilliant.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: Evhrada
title: Thank you for your kindness
body:
From the minute I arrived, only kindness, professionalism and utmost care was shown me. After finding a lump in my breast I was referred to the breast clinic. I was seen quickly, sent for mammogram, then an ultrasound, had 2 biopsies and back upstairs in a very efficient manner. Everything was explained every step of the way and a very daunting experience was made a bit easier.  
Thank you to all, I appreciate everybody’s kindness.

title: 'Very Caring/Compassionate' Practice Staff..
body:
On the 29th October 2021. I was taking my Father-in-law to an appt at the surgery. Before he got to his appt he suffered a Cardiac Arrest outside the Practice.The staff and that includes all of the Doctors, Nursing and Admin team came to our aid and to help with Dad's Resus, and also to offer help and comfort  to myself and his Two Sons. Also at Dad's aid were Air Ambulance Dr's, Paramedics and Crew. We would as a family like to Thank all in attendance for the caring and prompt action towards Dad's untimely passing.
I personally have never had a problem or bad experience at this practice. I have always found all the staff to be  professional and friendly and always quick to assist in any way they possibly can.
As a family we will always be forever grateful to St Stephens Gate Medical Practice, (and I am sure our beloved Dad would have felt the same too)!
Covid has made appointments and visits very difficult and it has put staff under a lot of pressure and stress! So we all need to be a little kinder and patient with each other especially in these unprecedented times. Thank You from all the Playford Family. And A 'Merry Christmas' to you all.

author: Serenity1962
title: Receptionists - The Mandeville Practice
body:
I have experiences with 2 types of receptionist behaviour here - 1 who will bend over backwards to help, and another that talks like they are reading from a script with no empathy at all. I have a telephone consult booked for 8th December. This was made at the request of my Oncologist as my Vit D levels are at about 80% lower than they should be. I waited until 5.00pm, and rang the surgery to check. As it happens, while I was waiting in the queue to be answered, the doctor was trying to get through to me! The receptionist and I had a giggle over this, and they said they would get the doctor to call me back either that evening or the next day.  
As I didn’t receive the call, I rang on Friday afternoon - and after being in the queue for 35 minutes, I spoke to another receptionist who insisted that the Doctors don’t do call backs! I explained the situation, and they said I would have to call back at 8.00 on Monday to book another telephone consult, but there wouldn’t be any appts until January. I asked if they could make an exception due to my circumstances but they would not budge - just kept repeating themself.  
[Unsure about 'Appointments']

author: chassisnn39
title: Queuing telephone system
body:
I got through to the recorded message for my GP at 8am. My GP practice is Old Swan Health Centre. I wanted to request a telephone consultation regarding a potential urgent health concern. I sat waiting, constantly being told that a receptionist will be with me as soon as one is available, for 57 minutes!  
When I told the person who answered how long I had been waiting, they stated that's just the system they use. Luckily an appointment was still available which is unusual as they are generally taken up in the first 15 minutes.

author: Gman2021
title: Wrong information
body:
Had to go into South Tyrone Hospital for a procedure, had to eat a special diet for a week & also take laxatives before my procedure which were brutal, I am currently taking medication for my heart & diabetes among other things & I asked to confirm which tablets I needed to stop & work tablets to stop.  
I was phoned back and was told that my medication was ok to keep taking until 2 hours before my admission, as I was having my procedure I was informed that I should have stopped my clopidogrel a week before my procedure therefore the Doctor could not take the required polyps he needed to & I would have to go through the whole experience again. If I was correctly informed in the first place the procedure would have been completed but now I'm told I will need to go through it again (not happening) I don't which Doctor the nurse asked or where so got her information but unfortunately again the Nhs has let me down once more but it will be the lat

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SJC1987
title: Matenity - IOL and EMCS Ulster Hospital
body:
I was induced in the Ulster Hospital a week ago due to Pregnancy Induced Hypertension. I had a propess put in place at 5.30pm on the Friday evening by a lovely midwife. Overnight, I was cared for by by someone else. They were outstanding, but for me this is when issues started. There is a single midwife assigned to a full ward; which quite frankly is not fit for purpose. I had to have the propess removed due to hyperstimulation and Heather was rushed off her feet, as it seemed as if every other person was going into labour and wheeled off the ward.  
I got no sleep and was pretty stressed by the environment itself. I was not aware at any stage that I could be in the induction ward for up to 48 hours; I would have refused this if I had known beforehand. A curtain separates you from the person beside you. It is noisy from others screaming in pain and vomiting. Partner visiting is very limited. Once my last midwife was off duty, I had the most surly, uninterested and uncompassionate midwife take charge of the ward. My propess was reinserted in the early hours and subsequently fell down the toilet.  
I felt like a bother to them from that point on and routinely ignored. I spent most of Saturday afternoon in tears, asking if I could go home, as I wasn’t making progress and not getting anywhere near the labour ward. Another midwife was sent in to speak to me who also did nothing to alleviate my concerns, if anything they made me more anxious, as they kept telling me to think about my baby, with no regard for my own mental or physical wellbeing.  
I waited until the nightshift came on and asked to go home again. At this point another midwife called the sister, who spoke to me and calmed me down. She was the first person who showed me any sort of compassion and didn’t treat me like a nuisance . I got moved to the labour ward within a couple of hours. If it wasn’t for them, I think I’d have been left there stressed to the hilt for a few days.  
The team on the labour ward did an outstanding job, they looked after me and were absolutely fantastic. organised my epidural with the doctor, and I was comfortable throughout. I laboured until 10cm dilated and pushed for an hour and half, when it was discovered that my son was back to back (they had came back to me from the previous evening and for that I was grateful). I was prepped for theatre for a vacuum delivery.  
This was attempted the maximum 4 times, before switching to an emergency section. As I had been dilated and my son was deeply engaged, this was a hard section. The team did everything to deliver my son safely, but I’m still in shock about how things turned out. I genuinely felt like my son and I were dying and I lost 1200ml of blood.  
I was moved to the maternity ward and then to a side room, as my son developed jaundice and had to spend a night in the neonatal unit under lamps. They on the maternity also did a brilliant job of looking after me despite being stretched so thinly. Again, the neonatal team did a great job of reassuring me and looking after my son.  
For those who think the NHS is in danger of being overwhelmed; maternity in the Ulster Hospital already is. The staff work flat out without breaks, and in my opinion, the induction ward puts women’s and children’s safety at risk due to current staffing levels and constraints from Covid. I know of other people who have had similar experiences to me who were induced recently. One of the midwives told me that number of sections is through the roof at the minute. I wonder how many of those people have been induced. I have been offered a debrief with the consultants which I plan to attend, but after my experience, and I know everyone says this, but I genuinely would not put myself through this again. In hindsight, if I could have had an elective section as opposed to an induction, I feel that the outcome might have been better for son and for myself.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Talinos
title: Fantastic staff
body:
Had an appointment on Christmas Eve with Mr Mohanty.  
I was very apprehensive as I knew is would cause me some short lived pain.  
From entering the department, all the staff I came into contact with were lovely. The receptionist and a couple of other staff trying to help me with a last minute food item I needed for Christmas.  
Mr Mohanty is professional and lovely and does his best to help you relax - and I was a wimp!  
Emma and Janet, the two nurses with me, were fantastic. Chatting to me and helping me try to relax to help the procedure.  
They couldn’t have been nicer and were so caring.  
Got some excellent advice on HRT and a book to help arm me with information before approaching my GP, dutifully ordered when I got home. If I should need any gynae-related appointments in the future I will request that I go back to Boston Pilgrim. What a team!

author: Bofa31
title: Exceptional ENT care for my father
body:
My father desperately need the valve in his throat changed. He had been unable to eat, drink or sleep for over 72 hours- not good for anyone never mind a man in his eighties. Unbelievably there were neither valves nor trained personnel available in his own health board for another 3 weeks taking us into another month and another year.  
I was desperate for my father to be “fixed” and was prepared to travel as far as Newcastle to make this happen. The local health board then managed to arrange an emergency appointment at Monklands. Joyce called me to discuss Dad’s issues, answered all my questions of which there were many! She was so lovely in her manner and empathetic too, explained Francine would be on ward 9 to treat Dad… the contrast could not have been more marked.  
They had the equipment and the trained personnel. The staff were absolutely lovely and whilst we waited friendly Francine came out to introduce herself and she explained she was being asked to help with another issue but informed us that Mel would be seeing Dad. Dad was very impressed with Mel, said she was caring, efficient and competent.  
On Christmas Eve, Joyce called me to see how Dad was... I was so touched by this, I can’t thank Joyce enough and hope NHS Lanarkshire realises how lucky they are to have a staff member like her. She is a total asset to the NHS and should be recognised accordingly .  
We are overwhelmed with the service and felt compelled to tell you. It has restored our faith in our amazing health service.  
I hope my local health board can learn some of the excellent practices your ENT have embedded. Joyce, Francine and Mel, thank you so much.

author: Middleage21
title: Effective triage
body: Very effective triage and clinical assessment - reassured and provided with treatment - seen face to face and given thorough assessment.

author: Dwcare
title: The care of my partner and myself received at New Cross hospital December 2021
body:
My partner (David) become ill quiet suddenly. He found eating difficult and was in terrible pain while passing urine. We had little success from the doctors surgery so visited A and E at New Cross hospital.  
David was admitted to hospital and underwent many tests which led to a number of operations.  
During his time in ICU and on ward A14 he was looked after with such care and compassion by ALL members of staff. It became evident that David was not responding to the treatment given. It was at that point that all staff involved with David's care showed me the same care and compassion as they did him. Everything was explained in detail. I was greatly supported throughout my time spent with him at the hospital. Nothing was too much trouble. Staff gave up their time to talk to me and check on my wellbeing whilst giving David such great care. David died on the 6th December. I will always be so thankful to the care and support given to both David and myself. I would like to thank all the staff that performed the operations, staff on ICU and on ward A14 at New Cross hospital. They all work so hard with such great care. Thank you

author: daughter02
title: Zoom call to Covid positive mum
body: Exactly on time. I was able to see mum at her bedside. I initially struggled to get the sound sorted but after that it was straight forward. Although it was difficult to keep the conversation flowing at times, it was great to see mum looking so well. She struggled at times to hear what I was saying, but knowing she was getting the call gave her something to look forward to. I'd recommend having a list of things ready for you both to talk about unless there are various people in the house having small chats. Really appreciate this service and the operator also relayed to mum anything she wasn't able to hear.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Coyw
title: Heart attack care
body:
In late December, I suffered what I thought was a heart attack. The ambulance appeared very quickly with two efficient and caring medics. The treatment happened quickly, however their biggest problem was trying to calm down my wife, which they did with a smile on their faces.  
I quickly found myself in Hairmyers hospital where I became the star in a scene from casualty. Surrounded by masked faces, an angioplasty was fitted and I was placed on a ward. I was scared and concerned that my wife would have no idea what was going on. Both of these problems were dealt with by a nurse called Andrew, who told me what had happened and what was going to happen. He also made that all important call to my wife. The next day, a team of nursing staff (led by a head angel) took over, who once again kept me informed and comfortable. I was about to be transferred to Wishaw, when I had an accident with a urine bottle. I was totally devastated and embarrassed by this. The nurse in charge gave me the best team talk I have had outside any rugby dressing room and sorted the problem with the minimum of fuss. On transfer to Wishaw General, I was placed under the care of nurse Gayle. Very quickly, she had me comfortable and safe. Because of the care of the nurses and Dr, I managed to get home. I am so grateful and thankful not only for you saving my life but treating me with dignity and respect. I think the NHS continues to be the best healthcare system in the world and this is for one reason only - the magnificent staff. Thank you for giving me my life back.

author: confederate frank
title: covid jab
body: I went for jab at the Marks & Spencer building. Great two nurses. I was waiting on jab, and she had already done it. Well done girls.

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Doctors and nurses were immediately helpful
body: I was brought into the hospital three weeks ago with jaundice and my blood wasn't clotting. The doctors and nurses were immediately helpful. The entire ward is spotless and I feel safe regarding Covid-19. However, as my dietician is advising eating in regular intervals, my meals are coming far too close together... I may end up having my dinner at 2pm during the day. Another problem I find is that there is no continuity with the consultants. I do understand that I will not have the same consultant every day, but I feel that I keep having to explain myself to every consultant and I can never move forward, as the following day someone new would be in.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant care
body: I was brought into the hospital 5 days ago with a shortness of breath. I have previously had a heart transplant so this was a major worry. The nurses and doctors were unreal. The ward is immaculate and I feel totally safe regarding Covid-19. I am hoping to get home today and just want to thank everyone on 1 North.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Autumn 50
title: My care at clinic F gynaecology New Stobhill Hospital
body: I attended as a new patient a few days ago. Booked in by a very helpful receptionist. My consultant met me - Dr Victoria - she was kind, caring and put me at ease. I had a procedure. She talked me through this gentle approach and also the nurse in room talked to me to ease my anxiety through this. She was reassuring in her manner. Bloods were taken by other nurses. They were professional and kind. The staff at this unit are very dedicated and work together as a great team. I am thankful for their care and hard work .

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Difficulty sleeping
body: I arrived in hospital about 2 weeks ago with ongoing heart palpitations. The doctors and nurses are nice, the food is satisfactory and the the ward is hygienic. However, I have real difficulty sleeping at night time. I understand that during the night patients have to be cared for, but the constant noise and lights are extremely irritating. It has come to a stage where I have to wear headphones to get any sleep. Despite sitting in a bed all day, I feel exhausted due to my lack of sleep during the night. That is my only complaint.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Can't complain
body: I am having difficulty with my joints, so I am in hospital waiting on an operation. I have absolutely no problem with the level of care I am receiving. Everyone is nice and the place is spotless (covid-19 is not a worry to me at the moment).

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Little things making the experience very difficult
body:
Our child has been in and out of blossom over 6 times this year due to a rare terminal illness. We can't thank the staff enough for their continued support and care- particularly Roisin and Doctor Thompson (who always provides a good laugh). There are just little things that would make this ongoing situation a lot better. Firstly, it is only a small thing, but it can be very daunting seeing the variety of colours of uniform- you don't know whether it is a physio, a dietician etc. It would make things a lot easier if there was a small laminated chart somewhere in the room to show the different colours of uniform and the corresponding job- for families like us who need to be aware of the different roles. Due to PPE at the moment (which is very much necessary), you can't see the name tag or role! Another small thing, is that there is no hanging space whatsoever, unideal when you are staying for long periods of time.  
The major problem I would say is the parking situation- which is atrocious. We generally have to stay in the hospital for days/weeks at a time... and we are expected to pay a parking fee! This is totally unfair as other hospitals in NI have a service which enables parents who are in with a terminally ill child to have free parking. Not only this, but you are expected to pay in cash which exacerbates the situation. Due to our digitally active world nowadays, everything is done through a contactless payment with our phone or card- rarely anyone has cash. As we generally leave the hospital at night time, there is no one at a service desk to open it for us if we don't have change at hand. Instead, we end up having to walk all the way into the building to take money from the ATM in A+E. We then have to buy something small in the shop to break down the money into smaller coins. This would be only an annoyance if you were a visitor, however, after a long day with an ill child, this should be the last thing we should have to worry about. There should be something implemented for free parking as a parent or at least a contactless service!!!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I don't feel safe in terms of covid
body:
I arrived on ward 1 North 9 days ago. I am awaiting a heart bypass surgery-which is more than I initially anticipated. Each and every staff member have been fantastic. A lady Angie has been marvelous- so caring, particularly a I was in over Christmas! My entire care plan has been clear as the staff are willing to explain it.  
However, the ward is definitely not clean. I don't feel safe in terms of Covid-19 as the hygiene is so poor. The bathrooms in particular have been horrible- urine is almost always on the floor when I go in. In fact, I have my own pair of gloves and wipes to clean down the surfaces. I understand that this is not the nurses job so I don't like to pester them, but on occasions, it has been that bad that I had no option but to do so. The cleanliness needs to improve!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Happy with everything
body: Due to a shortness of breath, I came into hospital to get checked out and was admitted- about 2 weeks ago. I am happy with everything- the nurses/doctors are nice. The cleanliness is ''90%'' and the food ''does the job''. No complaints!!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: happy with my experience
body: I am struggling with gallstones at the moment so have been put on a waiting list to receive an operation. My time in the hospital has been good. Nurses, doctors, cleanliness, food- everything has been adequate. Thanks to everyone on 4 South!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: asteropehy49
title: Member of staff
body:
My Mum visited Scarborough General Hospital for a CT Scan in the mobile unit just down from A&E.  
The member of staff, (I apologise but name something like Guck) could not help my Mum enough. She felt so comfortable, he explained everything to her, helped her put her coat on and helped her out of the unit. He could not do enough to help and my Mum could not praise him enough for his help and kindness.  
I hope this message gets to the right person.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: 123kt39
title: Lack of drs
body: I phoned out of hours GP but they had no drs.. How can they have not one Dr on duty. Therefore I was sent to children's a and e, and apparently they had no drs on either.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: januarydp88
title: Keep up the good work, you really are smashing it!
body:
I would just like to take a quick moment to thank all the staff members who are part of the paediatric diabetes team in the Southern Trust. I have been living with type 1 diabetes now for over 10 years and they have supported me immensely over this time. Each and every staff member is incredible at their job and really do make going to the diabetes clinic a good experience.  
I would especially like to mention Doctor Smyth. You have been incredibly kind, warm and caring as well as being incredibly good at your job. You have always taken your time with me during each consultation and provided great expert advice on managing various aspects of my condition. Thank you for your assistance over the years.  
I would also like to give a big mention and thank you to specialist diabetes nurses Pauline and Annette. You have both been an incredible support and help over the years. In my opinion you both are truly the best in your field.  
I would also like to commend the team on the transition clinic for those aged 16-21 that you have initiated. I have found this to be very reassuring in helping bridge the gap between paediatric and adult care, making the move across a much less dauting experience for me.  
So again, a big thank you to the whole team - keep up the good work, you really are smashing it!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything has been going smoothly
body:
When I first came to Craigavon Area Hospital I came through ED. It was an experience for me as it was very busy, what I feel needs to be improved in ED is that there needs to be more space as it can become very cramped and people are in very close proximity with you, which made me feel uncomfortable the whole time. Nurses in ED were great as you could see they were very busy but still managed to get around to everyone even though they were short staffed still did a great job.  
Now that I am on 2 South Ward everything has been going smoothly, as the care I am receiving has been great, the nurses are always checking in on your well-being which is very comforting to know that they are always there, anytime I have asked for something I have always gotten it no waiting about, food has been good, and cleanliness of the ward has been exceptional they are keeping the ward in great condition and I am always seeing a cleaner walking about the ward ensuring that everything is cleaned.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great staff they have here in Craigavon area hospital!
body: Big thank you to the staff who were working on Christmas day as they made it one kind for me, it was just great. Being in hospital on Christmas day isn’t the most pleasant place to be and is where no person wants to be during times like this however the staff were so lovely and they tried their best to make our Christmas day a good one, they were still working hard and never stopped it takes a lot for them to come in to work instead of taking it off but their care was amazing, bunch of great staff they have here in Craigavon area hospital!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: KGLKHG
title: Quick, slick and very person centred
body: Following a nasty fall I attended the Urgent Care centre at Burnley General hospital. From being guided through the self check in system by the ANP, given an allocated time slot, assessed by Rob, the physio, being x-rayed by Shinin the radiographer and given a follow-up appointment to fracture clinic, the whole experience was quick, slick and very person centred. Many thanks to you all, but especially Rob and Shinin for your care compassion and kindness.

author: pictorgs53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very Caring Staff
body:
After developing an irregular heart beat I came to the Emergency Department at Daisy Hill Hospital. I encountered a long enough wait but overall it was an alright experience. All the staff were fine - very nice.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has been a bit unsettled, however all the staff involved in my care have been good - very caring and good at their jobs.  
The only thing I can think of which could be improved would be if hooks could be gotten and put in the shower room. At the minute there is nowhere to hang up your clothes to avoid them getting wet - so hooks of some sort would be great at helping to avoid this problem.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: yellowwt86
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Top grade care
body:
I was taken via Ambulance to Daisy Hill Hospital after suffering from a mild heart attack. I was left sitting in the Ambulance for over 3 hours whilst I waited for a bed to become available. The ambulance crew were three very nice people - they were very pleasant.  
All the staff in A&E were absolutely brilliant.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward the staff have been absolutely first class. The ward itself has been very good and clean.  
The food I have received has also been very good - it has improved greatly since the last time I was in.  
I cannot think of any improvements to make - my care really has been top grade.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: marshs99
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Couldn't beat the care received
body:
After having chest pain, I came to A&E at Daisy Hill. I had a very good experience in the Emergency Department - it really could not be better. The staff were great - absolutely brilliant.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has also been really great - you really couldn't beat it. The staff are all excellent, they really couldn't do enough for you - they get you anything you need or ask for.  
The food has also been really good - I really had a lovely dinner today.  
I really could not see how my care could be improved - it has just been really good. The only issue which could be improved is waiting times but what can you do about that.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: venusrw59
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Overall good experience
body:
Following chest pain I was admitted to Daisy Hill via A&E. It was an overall good experience and all the staff were very good.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has also been very good. Every single staff member who has looked after me has been brilliant.  
The only thing I think could be improved would maybe be a bigger TV as they are quite small.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Middleage21
title: Kind and compassionate
body: Staff were kind and compassionate, looked after me, gave me a very good explanation of what was happening all the way through.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: plutowm63
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Thank you to the amazing staff
body:
Our time in Daisy Hill Hospital has been absolutely brilliant.  
Our hospital experience began in A&E. We were quite well looked after. Dr Laverty in particular was absolutely brilliant. She took time to make a room for us as bed space was tight.  
Up on the Children's Ward it has also been really great. The staff have been really lovely - they have been absolutely brilliant with my son. There has been no sitting about waiting - it has been really efficient.  
I would particularly like to mention nurse Naomh who keeps popping in and out. She has been absolutely lovely - really kind, caring and an absolute star.  
I would also like to mention cleaner Rebekah who has also been excellent. She has been very friendly and caring towards me and my son, taking time with us rather than just going in and out doing her job.  
However, all the staff have been really friendly and a big thank you to everyone who has helped look after my son.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: octansyx85
title: You are all simply amazing
body: I called nhs 24 for help with my unwell son on Christmas Eve and they helped me very promptly and sent me to Forth Valley A&E where I was seen firstly by the receptionist who was so lovely then really quickly by a nurse Corinne equally fabulous then an A&E doctor named Ben, he was simply amazing and I don’t feel I thanked him enough because I was so emotional at the time but I just want to let him know that he is amazing and how lucky I feel that we have the NHS ⭐️ you are all simply amazing 🙏

author: TM40
title: Treated with great respect
body: Staff were extremely welcoming, reassuring and efficient. Explained all aspects of my treatment clearly and were willing to discuss any concerns I had. Staff clearly working in a very challenging environment but remained dedicated to providing an excellent standard of care. I felt very well attended to, cared for and was treated with great respect.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Amy b
title: Really great care
body: Really great care at Argos Glenrothes Fife when getting booster by Matt.

author: Gemma21
title: Lovely members of staff doing a fabulous job
body: Paul and Linda were so helpful and chatty while getting my vaccine that it took the nerves off. Lovely members of staff doing a fabulous job. Thanks!

author: Madsaze85
title: Lovely welcome and kind staff
body: Quick and easy access to clinic. Lovely welcome from the door and shown to a seat. Linda the nurse explained everything clearly to my son prior to getting vaccine and Emma was very kind and made my son feel at ease. Well done.

author: Welsh93
title: Couldn't fault it
body: Went to the vaccination centre in Glenrothes for my booster and flu jab, everyone was amazing. The girl that gave me mines was named Emma and she was so quick and made it so easy. Couldn't fault it.

author: Boosted2021
title: Vaccinations
body:
I have had 2 vaccinations and a booster for covid 19 at Argos, Glenrothes and the staff could not have been nicer.  
On my first visit, the volunteer administering the injection turned out to be the Health Visitor that vaccinated my 14 year old son when he was a baby. It was lovely to see Margaret again.  
On my second visit, the process was smooth and even quicker than the first.  
My third visit was at the end of a long day but staff were still friendly and welcoming.  
Thank you to everyone involved in the delivery of these vaccines.

title: Treatment of the elderly
body: My 89 yr. mother contacted the surgery last Thursday to say she had the most awful cough, temperature and was feeling very unwell. The Receptionist told her to go the the chemist and get some cough medicine. She is 89 and disabled and can only walk with 2 walking sticks.  Even the pharmacist said they should not of said that! Today 5 days later her cough is worse and it now makes her sick. I will try to contact the surgery for her tomorrow to book some sort of consultation. She does not use a computer to register her ailments on-line. Please think more for the elderly. I know we are all going through a very stressful time and are under alot of pressure and stress.  She has been at this surgery for 40 yrs.  She deserves better treatment than what she received.

author: requirementxe77
title: My day to day life has improved greatly
body:
Hallo,  
I was an inpatient in Ninewells Hospital Dundee recently under the care of Mr.Majumdar ENT.  
I would like to express my sincere gratitude for the care I received from Mr Majumdar and his team and as a result of my treatment my day to day life has improved greatly.  
I count myself very lucky to be one of Mr.Majumdar’s patients.  
The very best wishes to all at Ninewells Hospital.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Madsaze85
title: Argos vaccine centre
body:
I brought my daughter along to the Argos vaccine centre for her covid vaccination. She was very nervous ( having had multiple medical treatments previously).  
All the staff were amazing , she got upset and we were moved to a small room. The nurse explained what was going to happen but also let my daughter explain why she was scared. After some breathing exercises, my daughter felt safe enough to allow them to do it with no bother. Thank you so much for taking the time to put her at ease and enabling her to trust you.

author: millimetergm67
title: Excellent care
body: Excellent care of a medically phobic young man, staff were kind and patient and utterly brilliant.

author: Ash87
title: Very kind and considerate
body: I had my booster and the nurses were very kind and considerate. Helped me get through the booking as there was an issue finding me but got there in the end and I received my booster and flu vaccine. The nurses/vaccinaters are doing a brilliant job especially in such hard times. They talk and ask about your day its such a delight. Well done!!!

author: Steph20198
title: Couldn't ask for better care
body: The nurses that where administering the vaccine where so caring and very friendly. Couldn't ask for better care while getting my 3 vaccines.

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

author: Kvwe99
title: This experience was far from the best
body:
We fully appreciate the Scottish Ambulance Service is under immense pressure just now, however there was no need for a crew to arrive and leave us feeling basically told off for calling a 999 Ambulance.  
It was last resort calling one and fully explained the situation to a Call Handler. They agreed an Ambulance was required and help was arranged.  
Throughout the whole time they were in the house I felt they were off hand and made us feel we were wasting their time.  
We've had various Ambulance Crews attend the wife over the years and have to say this experience was far from the best.

author: 123kt39
title: Communication about appointments
body:
I got a phone call from the health visitor team (Banbridge). The person I was talking to said they were a health visitor. It wasn't until I went to the appointment, did I realise the appointment was with a health visitor assistant. I only knew this because of their uniform and reading the red book when I got home. Not once did they say their job was an assistant, I believed they were another qualified health visitor.  
I don't mind being seen by assistants, but I feel they should make it clear they are assistants/auxiliaries.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: likeablets65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everyone really helpful and caring in maternity
body:
My time on the Maternity Ward has been good so far. The staff have all been absolutely brilliant.  
Big thanks to all the midwives involved in the delivery of my baby, and everyone who has looked after us since. You have all been really helpful and caring.  
The only thing I think could be improved would be that I didn't really get much food yesterday - I was in labour all day and missed lunch so I was quite hungry. However, today has been much better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: chassispk59
title: I couldn’t have asked for better treatment
body:
I spent 3 weeks in ward 33 at Victoria Hospital. Initially I was pretty scared and ill but the doctors and staff were excellent . The care I received was exceptional. They couldn’t have done more for me (or indeed anyone else in the ward). I have never had so many doctors involved in my care.  
The nurses were professional and incredibly caring. In the 3 weeks that I was there I saw many patients come and go and they all received the same exceptional treatment. The whole team showed consideration to my needs. There was always someone there to help - didn’t matter what you wanted . The food was good.  
I couldn’t have asked for better treatment. I really cannot criticise any of them in any way.

author: libratx88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: All staff nice and kind
body:
I brought my child to Daisy Hill following severe stomach pains.  
Our time in A&E was fine. We were a bit confused at first as we went to the wrong waiting area, but it was a bit better when we got to the right place. All the staff were lovely.  
Up on the Daisy Children's Ward it has also been good. Every staff member has been really nice and kind.  
Everything has been brilliant on the ward - there is nothing which could have been improved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great surgery
body:
Doctors, nurses and reception staff are all very helpful. I am been with this practice for 4 years. I always had a fantastic help. My Husband had all the essential help from this practice.
Thanks to all of them

author: mnms26
title: Fantastically helpful staff
body: I have been an outpatient twice in the past 2 weeks in ward 52 & 33 at Victoria Hospital, with both times spent in recovery unit. The staff were all fantastically helpful. Sean, Lorna, Nell, Billy, Ruth, Sarah, Tina, Jinty, Amanda, Rosie & everyone else that helped meanwhile I was in.

author: mineralth67
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Facilities and staff all lovely
body:
My child was admitted to Daisy Hill Hospital via A&E with bronchiolitis.  
Our experience in A&E was great. All the staff were really good.  
Up on the Daisy Children's Ward everything again has been fine. The facilities are all absolutely lovely. All the staff have been absolutely lovely.  
The only real problem that I have had which I think needs to be raised at a high level is that if you are not a breastfeeding mother you do not get any food. Parents are tired and anxious enough as it is and no food makes it worse and I really do not want to leave my child to go and get some. The current policy on this really needs to be reviewed.  
Other than this, everything else has been absolutely fine.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: authenticwc73
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care couldn't have been better
body:
I came to A&E at Daisy Hill after developing a bad cough. The staff in the Emergency Department were absolutely brilliant - they couldn't have been better. The doctor who looked after me was absolutely lovely and told you exactly what was going on.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has honestly been brilliant. The staff really could not do enough for you. All the members of staff are lovely; however Megan on today has been exceptionally great.  
I have nothing to suggest which I think could be improved - keep up the good work!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: rainzw77
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff do anything they can for you
body:
My hospital stay at Daisy Hill started in A&E. My time here was very good - I really couldn't complain. The ambulance crew who brought me in were also excellent.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has also been excellent. It really could not have been better. The staff were all very good - incredibly helpful - they really do anything they can for you.  
I honestly cannot think of anything to improve - you honestly wouldn't get any better, I have got everything I need.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: mercuryjx79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: No complaints about Daisy Hill
body:
I started in Daisy Hill's A&E after developing chest pain. I couldn't fault it - it was brilliant. Everyone was really good - all the doctors and nurses were lovely and brilliant.  
Up on the Male Medical Ward it has again been very good. All the staff are excellent - they are right there beside you when you need them. Joyce and Teresa in particular have been excellent, however all the staff have been equally as good.  
Overall, I have no complaints and anything I have asked for has been gotten for me.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: PositiveButHappy
title: PCR test result in under 13 hours
body:
Following my husband’s positive PCR result, I booked a PCR at Eastfied in Rutherglen for 11.00 am. I was dealt with almost immediately, and was able to leave very quickly. At midnight the same day, less than 13 hours later, I got an email confirming I was COVID positive.  
This is a tremendous service and I would just like to thank everyone involved in making this such an efficient operation. I read in the press that some people in Scotland are waiting up to five days for their result. That is unfortunate but I am sure it must be a combination of Christmas staffing and the huge increase in demand. Anyway, thanks again to all concerned.

readBy.name: Office of Clare Haughey, MSP for Rutherglen

author: foxtrotxh39
title: Very best paediatric care
body:
I was in Paediatrics in Crosshouse ward 1C shortly after having my baby. I was 7 days post section and had an unwell baby. There was one nurse that stood out from all the rest. This nurse was called Libby. I saw her again today when in receiving antibiotics for my baby. I was so happy to finally get her name so I could write this.  
Libby took the very best care of me at a time I was most vulnerable and felt so very alone and lonely. She took time out of what I imagine is a very busy job. Libby held my hand. She reassured me when I needed it more than ever and comforted me when I felt so very scared and isolated. The NHS need more Libby’s x

author: foxtrotxh39
title: Given the best care and reassurance
body:
I underwent a c-section in October and welcomed my gorgeous baby into the world. My section was semi traumatic for me, due to the consultant. My tubes and ovary were twisted and womb. I want to not talk about that.  
I want to write to recognise what went right that day. I want to write about the anaesthetist whose name was Nikole. I want to thank her from the bottom of my heart for taking the very best care and reassuring me when I felt so very alone and vulnerable. The kindness and time she spent making sure I was ok before during and after is something I’ll never forget. We need more Nikoles in the world. Thank you Nikole. I hope you received my letter. We are forever in your debt xx

author: foxtrotxh39
title: Wonderful breastfeeding support
body:
I received support from Marjorie. I ended up back in hospital 8 days post section due to what they believed to be a urine infection in my baby. They originally believed it to be a “feeding issue” Feeding after a caesarean is hard, let alone being full of self doubt and medical doubt. I was made to feel as if I wasn’t succeeding and seriously doubted myself throughout my stay. The doctors made me feel very doubting of myself and my ability to feed.  
That’s where Marjorie stepped in. She came from the breast feeding network to help and support me. Marjorie helped me in ways I’ll never be able to thank her for. She helped me, she reassured me and she comforted me when I needed it. Marjorie was wonderful in every way. She made me feel less alone while stuck in hospital without any support so shortly after my section. She popped in everyday and I looked forward to seeing her. She was wonderful. She built up my confidence up when it had been shattered. She spent time and effort to get me back to where I needed to be. Florence and I can’t thank you enough for all your kindness and help.

author: Dellboy
title: Exceptional treatment of my late Father
body:
This email will be directly delivered to the First Minister of Scotland too.  
As a family we lost our father to Aspiration Pneumonia, a condition we were not familiar with, in early November 2021. I come from a family of five siblings and myself six in total all of whom are grown and have families of our own. Regardless of our ages it was tough on us all. My father had been in and out or Hairmyres for the last four years. We laughed and teased him and would say Dad you have a loyalty card; he was renowned for his famous watch face containing a wedding picture of Mum in Dad in 1954. I believe every member of staff had seen it and remembered him by it.  
The reason for my writing this letter is to bring to your attention the great care, attention to detail, medical and emotional care & support supplied by the staff of Ward five. It was long haul for us all and after almost four weeks of treatment, going on to comfort him and then eventually end of life care. My Dad made such an impression on the staff and them to him. He gave them nicknames and they would laugh. He was clever right until the end and the staff stated themselves that he will be well remembered. They would kiss his forehead and say sleep well and, in the morning, he would be back up shaving. They were astounded by his fight. Obviously, the calm before the storm.  
Thanks to all staff in ward five. We would especially like to mention staff Nurse Lynsey, auxiliary Sharon and Judith, plus Jim Staff Nurse and Nadine final year student and Margarine as Dad called her. She was fond of Dad.  
I feel so badly for the negative press the NHS receives and especially the wait times, hence my letter. On no occasion did my dad wait any longer than 30 minutes for an Ambulance or out of hours doctor or care team to arrive, despite the very trying times and the Pandemic.  
So just to have it well noted as I know you personally do First Minister, we are one happy family. We have lost our dad but could not have asked for any better treatment and care in his final weeks, days, and hours. Thank you all sincerely forever grateful to the NHS.  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
  
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
.  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
  
[Very happy with 'Daily living support']

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: bus man
title: Wonderful vaccination service
body: I would like to to thank all the staff at M & S vaccination center for their wonderful work

author: Keen19
title: Exemplary care for my child
body:
Words can not explain how professional and reassuring the nurses and staff are at Royal Hospital Belfast for sick kids. The nurses in A&E are efficient, kind and real life angels for looking after my child so well, as well as many, many others. They are under a lot of pressure and take it in their stride, a life saving job that so many people couldn’t do or even comprehend.  
The care once we moved to the ward continued to be exemplary and I can’t thank the staff, especially the nurses enough. They deserve so much more than than anyone could ever give them.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Elizabeth21
title: Lack of empathy from out of hours GP
body:
My family arranged for an out of hours GP to visit my mum. She has been very unwell, frail, has dementia and had a fall and has been weak since Friday 24th Dec. I was with mum when the doctor arrived. He was abrupt, lacking compassion, empathy and sensitivity. He introduced himself and asked what's the problem. As my mum was so frail and confused, I explained the situation on her behalf.  
He went on to start examining mum and without saying what he was going to do, pulled the quilt down from her wee chest and started to listen to her heart. He also pulled her nightdress up to examine her tummy which was absolutely necessary, but he had a total lack of tact about it.  
I'm so saddened as my mum is a gentle, caring, loving wee person and she looked scared, as she didn't get any reassurance at all from the visiting doctor. As her daughter, I felt so disappointed to see my mum treated without the sensitivity she (and every patient) deserves. I work for the NHS and have done for over 20 years and I cannot understand why some staff appear to have such an appalling bedside manner.

author: LetItSnow
title: Long wait for prescription
body:
I called the Western Urgent Care receptionist on Sunday evening and gave my details, the issue and requested the appropriate medication I required. I was advised it could take up to 5 hours to receive a call back. On Monday morning I had a missed call from a private number (over 12 hours after my initial call). I rang the receptionist shortly after this to check if someone had tried to get in touch. I was advised that because I had missed the call it had been closed and that I would have to start again from scratch (I wonder if my original call could have been reopened so that I would not have had to go to the bottom of the list or if this is something that could be changed going forward?).  
The receptionist logged a new call and I gave the same details as before. I was told it could take up to 5 hours to receive a call back. I received a call 8 hours later from a Triage Nurse who advised me to go to A&E, Altnagelvin. I advised her that I only required medication (as I have had this issue before) and that this was not something that required a trip to A&E. I was then told I would be contacted by a Clinician which could take up to 5 hours.  
I received a call 17 hours later on Tuesday to say that I had been left a prescription in the Western Urgent Care Limavady centre which is twice the distance away from my nearest centre in Altnagelvin (I wonder if prescriptions could be picked up from your nearest centre if possible or if this is something that could be changed going forward?). Over 40 hours later and I finally have my medication.  
I would like to thank John in the Western Urgent Care Limavady centre who kindly gave me directions on where to pick up my prescription and advised which chemists were open. If you could pass on my gratitude to him.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: louiseandree
title: Good Covid Vaccine booster experience
body: The staff at The Studio, in Leven, Fife , were fabulous. Very friendly and made me feel at ease and well informed. Thank you! Tracey who administered my vaccine was really friendly and clearly experienced , I was made to feel so comfortable:)

author: Ethcas
title: Swift and efficient service
body:
The day my child and I arrived for their grommet operation we were met with absolutely amazing friendly staff, from the second we arrived until we left. Nothing was too much trouble. Everyone was kind, comforting and accommodating, from the reception staff to the surgical team no-one found us a bother.  
Everything was swift and efficient, these people do not get the recognition they deserve! From the bottom of our hearts we thank them all

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Fantastic care
body: I have been in hospital on Ward 1 South for about 7 weeks now as my bowels are not working as they should. It has been a long wait and I still have no idea how long I will be in hospital for. Despite this, the nurses and doctors have been fantastic! Also, the ward is always clean, which is a massive help.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great care but long wait in A+E
body:
I have been suffering with COPD for quite some time now. Recently it has become more apparent and I have started to feel generally unwell-dizziness, breathlessness etc.  
I arrived into hospital on Monday and had long wait in A+E. I totally understand that the hospital is under pressure at the moment. I was just ready to be admitted as I was so unwell, so the wait didn't help things! Otherwise, the care, the food, the staff- everything has been brilliant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My whole experience has been faultless
body: I fell and broke my arm at a trampoline park and received surgery in CAH. I have been in hospital for a few days now and am hopeful that I will get home today. The care has been excellent, the ward is spacious and extremely hygienic. My whole experience has been faultless- thanks to everyone in orthopaedics!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: No communication in triage
body:
I have been in hospital since Monday and I came in via A+E. I was waiting in triage for about 6 hours, with no one communicating to me. This left me feeling very uncertain as to whether I was going to be seen and I generally felt overlooked.  
I appreciate that the staff have a very difficult job but no patient should go 6 hours without being spoken to. I have eventually been admitted and receiving great care, it was just the initial wait that I am unhappy with.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Exceptional care
body: I have been in hospital since having a kidney stone removed yesterday. Everyone, from the tea ladies to the doctors, has been exceptional. I couldn't complain about my level of care! The ward is immaculate and I am made aware of my care plan as the staff are willing to explain anything. I am hoping to get home within a few days and want to thank 3 South for my care!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katf00
title: Fast and reassuring booster vaccine
body: Susan and Joyce so helpful when getting my booster. So fast and reassuring and I got a wee panel to cover me when I took my sweater off cos I had no top on underneath! And I also received 5 LFT kits as I had mentioned there was a shortage in Edinburgh where I live.

author: J&MD
title: Fantastic help and support
body: From entering the Pilgrim hospital this morning the help and support was fantastic. I was made to feel so welcome and comfortable by the staff in ultrasound and the women's clinic. Stephanie,Tracey and Janet from the women's clinic was amazing making myself and my relative aware of everything that I was going to be going through. During my examination it was lovely to be in such good company and caring staff.

author: Kernowbabe
title: Fantastic Tinnitus support
body:
I am suffering from tinnitus which started suddenly last year. The support I have had from my GP and the Hearing Therapy department at Royal Cornwall Hospital Treliske has been fantastic. It was severely affecting my mental well-being and life, but with the specialist assistance from my Hearing Therapist I am now on the road to habituation and although I still have a way to go I am now able to cope and look forward again in life.  
Thank you.

title: Great practice
body: All Reception staff we have talked to have been extremely kind and helpful. The Doctors are absolutely wonderful, caring and very easy to talk to. We have had a few problems lately and they have all been dealt with very quickly and very satisfactorily. Best practice we have ever been with.

title: Great GP
body:
I have been with Kenton Clinic for the past 4 years and they are very professional and friendly . My both childrens are always happy when they need to be seen by the doctor because he is very friendly and kind. 
Today I've had an telephone consultation regarding my sons year pain with the Doctor and immediately requested to attend the clinic even if he didn't have an appointment.
Thank you

title: Excellent
body: e-consult form completed (takes 5 mins) Tuesday morning - call back and telephone consultation with GP that afternoon and follow up appointment (short examination to confirm that all ok) Thursday morning. This is typical of our experience with the practice and we're very happy.

title: Superb care given
body: Amazing care given to my son who attended whilst working away from home.  I couldn’t fault the staff that cared for him and cannot thank you all enough
